Package server

Class UserAdmin

java.lang.Object
server.UserAdmin
public class UserAdmin
extends java.lang.Object
The UserAdmin class contains methods which interacts with the server and database when working with the User Table. Methods querying, creation, editing and deletion of user from the user table. This class file only consists of the encapsulation of methods, while the raw queries are found in DbUser.

  • Method Details

    • userExists

      public static boolean userExists​(java.lang.String username) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function checks if the desired user exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - A String which represents the desired username.
      Returns:
      Returns a Boolean which is true if the user exist, but false if the user does not exist.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • checkPassword

      public static boolean checkPassword​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String hashedPassword) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      This function checks if the hashed password entered from the CP matches the password stored in the database.
      Parameters:
      username - A String which is the username that the user typed from CP.
      hashedPassword - A String which is the user provided hashed password from CP.
      Returns:
      Returns a Boolean which is true if the password matches, but false if password mismatch.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Throws an exception when the hashing algorithm requested does not exist.

    • createUser

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge createUser​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String hashedPassword, boolean createBillboard, boolean editBillboard, boolean scheduleBillboard, boolean editUser) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This is a method to create a user in the database.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A string which is a session token from the calling user.
      username - A String which is the username to be created.
      hashedPassword - A String which is the user provided hashed password from CP.
      createBillboard - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the createBillboard permission.
      editBillboard - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the editBillboard permission.
      scheduleBillboard - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the scheduleBillboard permission.
      editUser - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the editUser permission.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerAcknowledge enum to indicate whether creation was successful or whether an exception occurred.
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Throws an exception when the hashing algorithm requested does not exist.
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • deleteUser

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge deleteUser​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String username) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException
      This is a method to delete a user from the database.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token from the calling user.
      username - A String which specifies the username to be deleted.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerAcknowledge enum to indicate whether deletion was successful or whether an exception occurred.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.

    • checkSinglePermission

      public static boolean checkSinglePermission​(java.lang.String sessionToken, Server.Permission requiredPermission) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function checks whether the provided username has the required permissions to invoke a particular function.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token from the calling user.
      requiredPermission - A Permission which is the required permission to execute the server method.
      Returns:
      Returns a Boolean which is true if the session token exists and the user has the required permission, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • getPermissions

      public static java.lang.Object getPermissions​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String username) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function gets the user permissions as defined in assignment specification, by viewing user permissions in the database and returns it an array list of booleans.

      If viewing your own details, no permission required. If viewing other's details, editUser permission required.

      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the sessionToken of the calling user.
      username - A String which is the the username of the user details to be retrieved from the database.
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList of Booleans of size 4 that indicates whether the requested user has the corresponding permission (order is createBillboard, editBillboard, editSchedule, editUser) or an enum to indicate insufficient permission to view requested user.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • listUsers

      public static java.lang.Object listUsers​(java.lang.String sessionToken) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function lists all the users from the database. This requires the edit users permission from the user.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token of the calling user.
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList Object of the usernames of all users in the database, InvalidToken if the session token is invalid, or InsufficientPermission if the user does not have the edit user permission.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • setPermissions

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge setPermissions​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String username, boolean createBillboards, boolean editBillboards, boolean editSchedules, boolean editUsers) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function sets all the user permissions in the database
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A string which is a session token from the calling user.
      username - A String which is the username to be created.
      createBillboards - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the createBillboard permission.
      editBillboards - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the editBillboard permission.
      editSchedules - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the scheduleBillboard permission.
      editUsers - A Boolean to indicate whether the user to be created has the editUser permission.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerAcknowledge enum to indicate whether it was successful or whether an exception occurred.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • setPassword

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge setPassword​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String hashedPassword) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      This function sets the password of a corresponding user.
      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A string which is a session token from the calling user.
      username - A String which is the username to be created.
      hashedPassword - A String which is the user provided hashed password from CP.
      Returns:
      Returns a ServerAcknowledge enum to indicate whether it was successful or whether an exception occurred.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Throws an exception when the hashing algorithm requested does not exist.

    • generateSaltString

      protected static java.lang.String generateSaltString()
      This function generates a salt string for storing/updating the user password.
      Returns:
      Returns a String which is the salt.
